required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Sargassum Horneri Extract on Patients With Hypersensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Sargassum Horneri Extract on Patients With Hypersensitivity

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators conduct a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to investigate the effects of Sargassum Horneri Extract in patients with skin hypersensitivity for 12 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock: Previous studies have indicated that Panax Ginseng C.A. Mey Extract may have the ability to improve liver function. Therefore, the investigators conduct a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to investigate the effects of the Sargassum Horneri Extract in patients with skin hypersensitivity for 12 weeks; the safety of the compound are also evaluate. The Investigators examine SCORAD(SCORing of Atopic Dermatitis) score, PGA (Patient Global assessment) score, IGA (Investigator Global assessment) score, total IgE, eosinophil counts, ECP, IL-4, IL-31, and TARC at baseline, as well as after 6 and 12 weeks of intervention. One hundred adults were administered either 1,000 mg of Sargassum Horneri Extract or a placebo each day for 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: SCORing of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) total score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline SCORAD total score at 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Change in SCORAD total score during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline PGA score at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in PGA score during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline IGA score at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in IGA score during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline total IgE (IU/mL) level at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total IgE (IU/mL) level during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline eosinophil counts (/uL) at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in eosinophil counts (/uL) during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline ECP (μg/L) level at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in ECP (μg/L) level during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline IL-4 (ng/mL) level at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in IL-4 (ng/mL) level during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline IL-31 (ng/mL) level at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in IL-31 (ng/mL) level during 3 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline TARC (pg/mL) level at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Change in TARC (pg/mL) level during 3 months

arm_group.description: This group takes Sargassum Horneri Extract for 12 weeks.
This group takes Placebo Extract for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: This group takes 1,000 mg/day of Sargassum Horneri Extract for 12 weeks.
This group takes 1,000 mg/day of Placebo Extract for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Atopy by Hanifin & Rajka diagnostic criteria
- SCORAD < 40
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abnormal liver or renal function (i.e., serum aminotransferase activity > 3 times of upper limit of reference range and serum creatinine concentrations > 1.2 mg/dL)
- Diabetes (diagnosed clinically or fasting glucose level > 126 mg/dL)
- History of viral hepatitis or cancer
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- History of serious cardiac disease such as angina or myocardial infarction
- History of gastrectomy
- History of medication for psychiatric disease
- Administration of oriental medicine including herbs within the past 4 weeks
